title: Registration Form with Validation
description:
Build a registration form with real-time field validation. The form should provide immediate feedback as users type, guiding them toward valid input.

Extract your validation logic into a custom hook called useFormValidation to keep your component clean and reusable.

The form should feel responsive — validate on blur or with a short debounce as the user types, and disable the submit button until all fields pass.
requirements: Build a form with fields: Name, Email, Password, Confirm Password
Validate Email: required, must be a valid email format
Validate Password: required, minimum 8 characters, must contain at least one number and one letter
Validate Confirm Password: must match the Password field
Show validation errors below each field on blur or as the user types (debounced)
Disable the submit button until all fields are valid
On successful submit, display a success message showing the submitted data (except passwords)
Extract validation logic into a custom hook (useFormValidation)
testCases: Renders all four form fields (name, email, password, confirm password)
Shows error when name is less than 2 characters
Shows error for invalid email format
Shows error when password lacks a number or letter or is too short
Shows error when confirm password does not match password
Submit button is disabled when form has validation errors
Displays success message with submitted data on valid submit
Validation logic lives in a custom useFormValidation hook
